qas.question: What did the Endangered Species Act authorize the Secretary of the Interior to do?

answers.text: list endangered domestic fish and wildlife

qas.question: The Endangered Species Act permitted how much annual expenditure by the US Fish and Wildlife Service for habitat purchase?
The Endangered Species Act gave the Secretary of the Interior administrative power of what organization?
How did the Endangered Species Act impact wildlife commerce?

answers.text: The act did not address the commerce in endangered species and parts

qas.question: How did the Endangered Species Act impact other agencies not specifically mentioned in the Act?

answers.text: Other public agencies were encouraged, but not required, to protect species

qas.question: How much could the Act spend per year?
Who runs the United States Fish and Wildlife Service?
What commerce did the ESA affect?
What animals could not be listed as endangered due to this act?
What did the National Wildlife Refuge System preserve?

context: It authorized <b6_0>the Secretary of the Interior<b6_0/> to <a0_0>list endangered <b8_0>domestic fish and wildlife<b8_0/><a0_0/> and allowed the United States Fish and Wildlife Service to spend up to <a1_0><b5_0>$15 million<b5_0/> per year<a1_0/> to buy habitats for listed species. It also directed federal land agencies to preserve <b9_0>habitat on their lands<b9_0/>. The Act also consolidated and even expanded authority for the Secretary of the Interior to manage and administer <a2_0>the National Wildlife Refuge System<a2_0/>. <a4_0>Other public agencies were encouraged, but not required, to protect species<a4_0/>. <a3_0>The act did not address the commerce in <b7_0>endangered species and parts<b7_0/><a3_0/>.
